alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Harrison; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 9:58AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Harrison, southeastern Crawford, southeastern Perry, Meade, northwestern Hardin and Breckinridge Counties through 1030 AM EDT/930 AM CDT/... At 957 AM EDT/857 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carefree Town to 9 miles southwest of Hardinsburg. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Crawford, southeastern Perry, southern Harrison, Meade, northwestern Hardin and Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Dyer, Frymire, Buras, Big Spring, Buck Grove, Tar Fork, Cedar Flat, Kirk, Bewleyville and Basin Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon EDT/1100 AM CDT/ for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
